intro: Conyza microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed cudweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its small, yellowish flowers are followed by fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Conyza microcephala is known for its adaptability and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
